boardgame.name: Der Formen-Kobold
boardgame.description:
Simple educational game about shapes of items. The components are items created from two jigsaw puzzle pieces each, plus some tiles which show the entire shape of an item and a kobold figure. There are various game ideas included.
The youngest children just assemble the items. The second stage of the game includes finding a shape that matches one of the items, then places the kobold on another shape which the next player has to identify.
In the most advanced game, some items are laid out on the table and the tiles are placed into groups. Now a shape tile is flipped open and the players check whether it matches any of the items currently open. If yes, the item is placed on the tile and a new item is added. If not, the kobold moves on. If the players manage to put all the items on the tiles before the kobold is back in its original position, all players win.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

boardgame.name: Journey
Journey (2012)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Although there are no instructions, aside from learning the controls as you play, this game is easy to comprehend and instinctual in its goals. As a robed figure, you travel through beautifully captured landscapes of deserts, hills, snowy wastes, and ruins, towards a faraway mountain split by a beam of light. Along the way, you decide on a path through obstacles with help from a magic scarf and abstract creatures along the way. If there is an on-line connection, other players can be observed, even helped, although other communication cannot be made. The highlight of the game is its gentle artwork and music and sense of discovery; a game to be experienced on those levels rather than for its gameplay.

Microbadges

Journey fan

boardgame.name: Follow Me!: Mission #1 – Viva La Resistance
boardgame.description:
User Summary w/ Publisher Information

Produced by BOA Publishing, this unofficial expansion of the Ambush! family of games requires only the base game to play. This stand-alone mission is the first installment of a planned 4 part series.

Viva La Resistance places your squad in a semi-quiet sector of the front line in France. Your squad is ordered to make contact with French Resistance fighters who have arranged to link up with U.S. forces in order to pass off a downed B-17 officer that needs to be escorted through friendly lines.
Along with your normal choice of weapons your squad will be issued Rifle Grenades and two adapters. Rules on the use of these are included with the mission. You also receive 14 new soldier cards printed on hard cardstock. There are 6 pages of new paragraphs and 2 conditions also printed back to back on hard card stock. Set includes one minor vehicle (a horse drawn wagon), and a counter for this vehicle is included.

This is a long mission as far as time to complete is concerned. Quite a lot of game time is spent in Rounds instead of operations, which tends to slow things down quite a bit. This mission can also turn deadly very quickly. If you're using a squad built up during the course of the entire series be extra cautious, don’t win at all costs. Proper tactics will aid you during this mission.

boardgame.name: Follow Me!: Mission #2 – Verletzer Tieger
boardgame.description:
User Summary w/ Publisher Information

Produced by BOA Publishing, this unofficial expansion of the Ambush! family of games requires only the base game to play. This stand-alone mission is the second installment of a planned 4 part series.

Verletzer Tieger takes place in an area of the front lines where the Americans are pushing forward and then getting forced back causing the lines to blur. Many units on both sides have become separated from their parent units greatly confusing the situation. Your squad is being sent forward to recon a small village and establish if the town's bridges are viable for tank and heavy vehicle traffic in preparation for another big Allied push.

During the mission briefing your squad receives a welcome volunteer, a combat medic. (Rules for the Medic are included in the mission.) The two major components of your medic will be his medical skill and his temperament. One determines how successful he we be at treating the wounded, the other determines how Gung Ho he is. You may end up with a great healer who has a very low initiative that your squad has to baby sit or a so-so healer that knows how to dispense some powerful preventative medicine. (There is an option in the rules to make the medic a permanent part of your squad for future missions.)

This mission includes four vehicle summary cards, one of which was created for this mission, the Marder II. (It has its own vehicle summary and the mission ships with a counter displaying the Marder II.)

This mission also comes with the following:
- 15 new soldier cards printed on hard cardstock
- 10 pages of new paragraphs
- 1 Mission Cartridge with 2 conditions
- Mission Summary and special movement rules for the German Halftrack

boardgame.name: Shadow Squadron
boardgame.description:
The player controls one of two star fighters; like Star Wars Arcade and Star Fox, the ships are built with polygon type shapes. The player can control the tilt of the ship, making flying upside down, simple and can fly in any direction. There is a target locking system that help the player find enemies quickly, as well as shows which enemies are closer by a number at the targets side. Besides lasers both ships also have their own type of torpedo. An energy shield can be turned on and off when needed, to save energy. And a circular radar display appears at the bottom of the screen, which also tilts as the ship does allowing you to tell it your above an enemy. And a next target arrow showing you which direction the nearest enemy is.

There are two main type of enemies, fighters and Carrier ships, both types of ships must be destroyed before the current mission is complete. The buttons used to shoot and speed up, and such can be changed on the options menu of the game before beginning. There are Easy and Hard settings, and an object viewer option to get a closer look at what enemies you will have to face, you can zoom in and out as well as tilt and rotate the ship in any direction. A sound test allows the player to listen to the music or sound effects, and another on off option can be used to turn the game's music and sound effects on and off before playing. The player can also change the speed control of their ship so it will go back to a standard speed if not pressing a button, or stay at one speed until you press the break or thrust. Players can also change the color of their ships and the enemies. If using the six-button controller the mode button can be used to enter "Chase" view which is seeing the fighter from behind rather than the cockpit. If the player chooses the second fighter they will have the option of choosing auto-pilot, which allows the computer to fly and the player to concentrate on fighting. In two player mode player one can control the gunner and the second can control the pilot. There are six missions, and before each a tactical display will show the players ship and where the enemy, and any other targets, or obstacles. There are two additional options that appear on the title screen after playing, the first is a "Trace" mode that allows the player to view a record of the last mission of their last game played, as if it were filmed and pieces of film where pieced together, with zoom ins tilts and following camera angles. The second option that appears is a score option that lets you[who?] see how well you did, but this is only viewable after you've beaten the game once, the title screen will eventually reappear and this option will be added to it.

There is very little story in the game itself, only mission objectives, mostly the story comes from the instructions and the box.

"Scramble Fighters! Chaos has broken out on the edge of the Galaxy. A diabolical power has begun construction of a powerful sun laser. You are the Shadow Squadron's newest fighter jock and the fate and hope of the federation rest in your hands. Destroy the Sun Laser or face the FIRE!!!" --From the back of the Box.

"This Means War O.K. cadet, listen up. We have a situation here, the kind that doesn't go away by itself. Something has knocked out our early warning network at the source. Outpost 51 is monitoring coded transmissions from sector 7. We are registering energy blooms from an unknown number of large ships near the Outer Boundary. One plus One plus one equals our old adversaries planning something big - big time. Why am I telling you this? Wake up, cadet! Where is Outpost 51? And where are we? Get it? The Acceleration Gate at sector 4 is still being assembled, so our defense ships at 11 can't get here in time. We're the only thing between the enemy and 17 major planetary systems. You've trained for the last 6 years to be in the Shadow Squadron. Well, you're being bumped from Cadet First Class to Flight Officer as of right now. The Fleet Academy has a tradition of excellence that is unsurpassed, and you're going to make sure it stays that way by being the first on the scene, and the last one standing when the dust clears. Is that clear - Captain? --From the Instruction booklet.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shadow Squadron", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Follow Me!: Mission #3 – Toll Bridge
boardgame.description:
"Follow Me! Mission #3: Toll Bridge": produced by "BOA Publishing", this unofficial expansion of the Ambush! family of wargames requires both Ambush! and a map from Ambush! Purple Heart to play. This stand-alone mission is the third installment of a planned 4 part series.

Toll Bridge is an airborne mission. Your squad has been handpicked for a night drop into a lightly guarded area containing three bridges. You must secure at least one bridge, all three if possible, and hold until dawn when reinforcements supported by tanks will cross. The bridge garrison is small and reported to be staffed by old men and boys. As long as surprise is on your side your men shouldn’t have a problem...

You may take your Medic (from Follow Me! - Mission #2) along for the ride. You also receive two Engineers to help with any explosives placed to blow the bridges. You'll even get some heavy weapons to aid you along the way.

In addition to Ambush!, this mission requires half map B from the Ambush! Purple Heart module

This mission includes the following:
- 4 new vehicle summary cards
- 21 new soldier cards printed on hard card stock (these must be cut out)
- 10 pages of new paragraphs
- 2 mission cartridges with 3 conditions
- 6 page mission summary with several special rules
- 1 wooden building overlay counter printed on hard card stock to be placed on the map.

This mission is the most complex of the series to date and it was designed so that it could be enjoyably replayed many times. There are several small events that probably won't occur on every playing and some activations create random placements of enemy forces on the map. (In this way no replay of the mission should be exactly the same and your forces won’t be able to set up ambushes for the Germans as you replay the scenario.) There are even a number of optional objectives that can be achieved in various ways.

boardgame.name: Double Dragon 5: The Shadow Falls
Double Dragon V: The Shadow Falls
boardgame.description:
Double Dragon V: The Shadow Falls is a 1994 American-produced sequel to Technos Japan's Double Dragon series.[4] Unlike the previously produced Double Dragon games, Technos had little or no credited involvement in the development of the game outside of licensing the series' name to publisher Tradewest (the publisher of the first Double Dragon and Super Double Dragon). Instead, the game was developed by Leland Interactive Media, a subsidiary of Tradewest. Unlike the previous games, which were side-scrolling fighting action games or beat-em-ups, Shadow Falls is a Street Fighter II-style head-to-head fighting game based on the animated Double Dragon TV series. Technos would later produce its own fighting game based on the Double Dragon movie the following year simply titled Double Dragon for the Neo Geo. Shadow Falls was originally released for the Super NES and Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, and later released for the Atari Jaguar by Telegames in 1995.

Source: Wikipedia, "Double Dragon V: The Shadow Falls", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

超人狼戦記WARWOLF（ウォーウルフ）
boardgame.description:
The evil Dr. Faryan and his army of bio-engineered monsters has taken over the colony known as Red Earth. One warrior though has gained the powers of a werewolf and challenges Dr. Faryan.

You start the game in human form, but by finding a Red W icon, the human is able to transform into a werewolf creature. The werewolf form offers higher jumps, quicker speed, greater strength, a shockwave attack, and the ability to climb walls. Also by collecting orbs you can became a super werewolf, increasing your strength, speed, and defense. Accidentally grabbing a blue W icon or losing too much energy will change you back into a human.

There are only 5 stages, but the game is infamous for its difficulty. it also came with a comic book.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werewolf:_The_Last_Warrior," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Wolverine: Adamantium Rage
ウルヴァリン
boardgame.description:
The SNES version follows Wolverine as he receives a mysterious transmission via computer; someone or something has information about his past and arranges for them to meet at an undisclosed location in Canada. It's here where the game's first stage begins; a laboratory teeming with armed guards and sentry robots.

The Mega Drive/Genesis version had a narrative that was a little more vague in its presentation. Wolverine is shown holding a photograph of someone from his past, and expresses his desire for revenge. He then recounts the procedure that he underwent which bonded Adamantium to his bones. It's at this point where the same laboratory level begins without much explanation as to why, or how Wolverine got there.

The rest of both games see Wolverine chasing down details to his past while meeting and battling several villains and arch-enemies along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wolverine: Adamantium Rage", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Buzz! Buzzers
boardgame.description:
The Buzz! Buzzer is a special controller set designed specifically for the Buzz! game series. The controller features four handsets, each of which has a large red buzzer button and four smaller coloured buttons for picking the answer from the on-screen options. The buzzer set is a USB device, and connects to the USB ports on the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation 3.

The Buzz Junior games came with a new set of Buzzers but like the PS3 games the old Buzzers can be used. These new buzzers still use wires and are not wireless. The only difference is that the buttons, are shaded that colour , instead of the outline.

Buzz!: Quiz TV saw the release of a wireless version of the buzzers. They connect to the PS2 or PS3 system via a USB dongle. Each dongle can support up to 4 wireless buzzers so this means another dongle is required for 8 player play with 8 wireless buzzers. The wireless buzzers can be used with both the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation 3 and all previous Buzz! games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Buzz!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Nintendo DS Guitar Hero Grip
boardgame.description:
The Guitar Grip is required to play the game and comes as part of a bundle that can be purchased for each installment. The Grip is designed for the DS Lite, but features a small adapter that can be removed for use in the older Nintendo DS models. Four fret buttons are located on the side of the unit near the cartridge slot. This is one less than the normal five frets, included an orange-colored one, managed by other Guitar Hero controllers. A wriststrap is attached to the underside to provide support while playing. The player holds the unit in a vertical book orientation (similar to Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword or Hotel Dusk: Room 215), and uses a special guitar pick-shaped stylus to strum on the touchscreen of the DS with his or her free hand.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guitar Hero: On Tour series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation Super Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A compilation box of the first four CSI-games.

Each game follows roughly the same pattern, you play a new recruit at the crimelab, partnering with each of the main characters of CSI in turn as you go through the cases (in the early games, Greg will assist you in the lab but in the later ones Greg has become a field operative, just like in the series, so you're on your own in the lab). The final case will tie into one or two of the earlier ones and provide more information about what happened.
